text: ah hi everyone slap the knee suit tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review
of this new black midi album
cavalcade this is the newest full-length
lp from uk rock outfit black midi
their sophomore effort following the
critically acclaimed
schlagenheim in 2019 one of the most
daring and creative post punk records
i've heard in a while
it is not a perfect lp but if black midi
showed anything on that project
it's their willingness to just totally
screw
conventions and if anything defines
cavalcade i think it's that
so much so the band doesn't even sound
like they're playing in the same
genre at this point even with post punk
being
the very fluid and umbrella type genre
that it is
if anything the band has gone full avant
prague on this one with a violent blend
of jazz
art noise and math rock for some music
fans this lp may seem like it's coming
totally out of left field like
the sounds you're hearing here are
beyond belief but black midi's efforts
here
actually plug into the uk's rich history
of boundary pushing rock
whether you're talking about prague
legends like king crimson
numerous bands from the canterbury scene
as well as henry cowe's rock in
opposition
black midi doesn't base the entirety of
their efforts in that style on this lp
though for one the band does their
damnedest to
deliver the most hyper aggressive and
noisy take on the style they possibly
can
their approach is so extreme cavalcade
will most likely appeal not to your
average prague fan but
your average punk or no waver black midi
also takes care on this lp
to lace this track list with the kind of
whimsical balladry the indie set would
love
i mean all in all this record is a lot
to take in trying to explain it in the
abstract makes it sound almost
random or nonsensical like there's no
possible way it could all make sense
together
especially considering it's reduced down
to 40 minutes and eight tracks
and yet for the most part it does what
cavalcade lacks in
overall cohesion it easily makes up for
in awe-inspiring beauty
and insanity the opening track here john
l is sure to either blow minds or break
mute buttons
either way it's a song that is nearly
impossible to listen to
casually it demands a reaction from you
it forces a reaction which it does with
syncopated drum and guitar passages
honking horn leads chirping violin and
piano embellishments that sound like the
entire freaking thing is just getting
thrown down the stairs
it's a cacophony worthy of the title
cavalcade plus on top of it there is
this
intense nightmare spoken word that
sounds like something
i don't know out of the captain
beefheart playbook which is really just
the icing on top
now the ending of this track flows
quickly into the following marlene
dietrich where we have a total 180 in
terms of mood
as this track is an eccentric ballad
with lovely string work
starts very subtle and artsy like a wild
beast's
song especially on those hushed vibrato
vocals but as the song opens
up emotionally and instrumentally it
runs more like a classic piece of scott
walker or like some old school
60s lounge or blue-eyed soul but the
following cut drives us right
back into the chaos the intro features a
tense crunchy groove that reminds me of
like
a primus record but without the slap
bass the whole thing
quickly smooths out into this gorgeous
mathy jazz rock
with plucky melodic embellishments
slipping in and out of frame the second
half builds intensely into this
procession of
grooves and riffs that thrash about
wildly
eventually hitting this buzzing
thunderous zappa style crescendo of
instrumentation where you have all of
these layers just
hammering on the same melodic theme plus
the sudden synth
dive bomb at the end that finishes the
whole track out hilarious the song slow
features more tense mathy jazz rock with
a guitar lead that just
sticks in my freaking head
[Laughter]
there's a somewhat spacious breakdown in
the middle of the track and the
instrumental build from there is organic
and immaculate with the band
occasionally hitting these lush
thick descending chord progressions that
are just so incredibly sinister and
orgasmic at the same time this whole
portion of the song really the track in
general feels like
that moment in a twilight zone episode
where the main character realizes
no matter what they're doomed so again
even though this record is not super
long
just 40 minutes or so there's still a
lot to take in
a lot to digest and the song diamond
stuff is kind of like that
lengthy breather in the middle of the
record to sort of settle in
really one of the only moments on this
lp i think you can listen to casually or
find some true calm in and while much of
the time i am pretty enchanted with its
subtlety
i do wish it came to a stronger
instrumental conclusion at
any point really though i do appreciate
the gentle acoustic arpeggios and
woodwinds at a few points
sounding like something off of grizzly
bear's yellow house the vocals on
dethroned bring that scott walker vibe
back with a touch of david bowie as well
it's almost like if black star had
become a tense jazz prague epic
and i suppose the performance on this
track is tight for the most part the
energy is there
but compositionally speaking this is
actually one of the more tame and
predictable moments on the lp
the instrumental layering is nowhere
near as dense or creative
and it's somewhat underwhelming for it
thankfully the heat does turn back up on
the song hogwash and balderdash
though the brevity of it leaves it
feeling like a more condensed and
aggressive version of everything we've
been hearing up until this point
regardless i think the track does work
as a quick explosive prelude to the
lengthy finisher ascending forth
which is a lusciously arranged piece
featuring elements of indie folk
classical and jazz i love the odd croons
the smooth finger picking the super
sweet chord changes
this track quiets any doubt that black
midi could write a serious
length and play with some real finesse
and yes it's a very odd
beautiful powerful finish to an odd
beautiful
powerful record which i love quite a bit
i think has a super strong first half
but there are a few tracks past that
point that in my opinion could have been
improved somewhat but regardless of any
hang-ups i have with cavalcade black
midi stays being
one of the most interesting and exciting
bands in rock music today
feeling a decent two strong eight on
this one tran
position have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head it's another
video that you could check out hit that
up or the link to subscribe to the
channel
anthony fantano cavalcade black midi
but forever
